wikipedia_page.main: Roy Pascal  (28 February 1904 – 24 August 1980) was an English academic and scholar of German literature. After an early career at the University of Cambridge, he was Professor of German at the University of Birmingham from 1939 to 1969.

response: *1969: Essays in German Culture, Language and Society. London: University of London, editor with R. Hinton Thomas, Leonard Wilson Forster, Roy Pascal

According to British philologist Roy Pascal, Goethe and Jane Austen were the first novelists to use this style consistently and 19th-century French novelist Flaubert was the first to be aware of it as a style.
Roy Pascal cites Goethe and Jane Austen as the first novelists to use this style consistently.Roy Pascal, "The Dual Voice", Manchester University Press, 1977, page 34
